summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued to Verizon Communications by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, demanding telephone records for specific numbers from July 6, 2019 onward. The subpoena is part of a criminal investigation into suspected felony violations including conspiracy, false statements, and obstruction of justice, and includes a request for confidentiality.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena to Verizon Communications as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: Verizon Communications commanded to appear before the grand jury at the United States Courthouse in Manhattan to testify and produce records.

events.title: Start Date for Records Request
events.description: The subpoena requests all telephone records from this date forward, indicating the investigation's focus on activity from this period.

locations: Verizon Communications, 180 Washington Valley Road, Bedminister, NJ 07921
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
U.S. Attorney's Office, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena targets telephone records for specific numbers from July 6, 2019 onward, indicating an active investigation at that time.
The investigation involves suspected violations of federal statutes including conspiracy (18 U.S.C. ยง 371), false statements (18 U.S.C. ยง 1001), and obstruction of justice (18 U.S.C. ยง 1519).
The U.S. Attorney's Office requested Verizon to keep the subpoena confidential to preserve the investigation's integrity.
The document is dated August 13, 2019, which is after Jeffrey Epstein's arrest on July 6, 2019, suggesting this is part of the post-arrest investigation.
The subpoena demands comprehensive subscriber, billing, location, and call detail information, showing a broad data collection effort.
